thread.title: Marshawn Lynch and Starbucks create 'Beast Mode' Frappuccino
thread.title_full: Marshawn Lynch and Starbucks create 'Beast Mode' Frappuccino

author: MICHAEL SCACCO
title: Marshawn Lynch and Starbucks create 'Beast Mode' Frappuccino
text:
Marshawn Lynch added "Beast Mode" to the Starbucks menu. 
Marshawn Lynch teamed up with Starbucks to put beast mode on the menu. 
The Seattle Seahawks running back created his own blend of ingredients for a new Frappuccino dubbed Beast Mode — which will go on sale Thursday. 
The caffeinated beverage is a mix of mint, cream, matcha, purple berry drizzle, whipped cream and protein powder to give an added boost. 
"I'd drink this before a workout," Lynch said in a statement. 
"You could get your buff on with this." Starbucks announces new Marshawn Lynch-inspired 'beast mode' frappuccino https://t.co/Kg5DTprWaO pic.twitter.com/HQoHtXiXOF — For The Win (@ForTheWin) October 20, 2015 
The drink will be available through the end of the NFL season and for every cup sold, the coffee company will donate 24 cents to Lynch’s Fam 1st Family Foundation. 
Lynch founded the charity with Buffalo Bills quarterback Josh Johnson in 2011. 
Starbucks hopes to donate up to $100,000 by the end of the season, and will kick it off with an initial payment of $24,000.
